SUMMARY: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

Class Ext.ux.netbox.date.DatePeriodOperator

Extends Ext.ux.netbox.core.Operator.
Defined in DateOperators.js

This is the class that implements the period operator. The id of the operator is DATE_PERIOD The available periods are the following: 

  LAST_YEAR: between now and now -1 year
  LAST_MONTH: between now and now -1 month
  LAST_WEEK: between now and now -1 week
  LAST_DAY: between now and now -1 day
  LAST_HOUR: between now and now -1 hour
  LAST_QUARTER: between now and now -15 minutes

Method Detail

convertValue

Array convertValue(value)
    This method convert an old value in a filter to a new value, suitable for this operator. If the given value is an array, with at least one element, this element is an object with {label:...,value:...} and the value is in the period store, an array with the first element is returned, an empty array otherwise.
    Parameters:
      Object value - The value to convert
    Returns:
      Array The converted value

createEditor

Ext.Editor createEditor(operatorId)
    This method retruns an Ext.ux.netbox.core.AvailableValuesEditor used to edit the periods.
    Parameters:
      String operatorId - The operatorId actually used in the filter
    Returns:
      Ext.Editor The field used to edit the values of this filter

getDefaultValues

Array getDefaultValues()
    Overwrite getDefaultValues function to return last day as default
    Returns:
      Array default values ([{value: "LAST_DAY", label: this.dayText}])

setPeriods

setPeriods(store)
    This function sets the store of the periods. The store must be local, and must have the label and value column The default store is the following: 
    new Ext.data.SimpleStore({fields: ['value', 'label'],
 data: [
   ["LAST_YEAR","last year"],
   ["LAST_MONTH","last month"],
   ["LAST_WEEK","last week"],
   ["LAST_DAY","last day"],
   ["LAST_HOUR","last hour"],
   ["LAST_QUARTER","last quarter"]
 ]});
    Parameters:
      Ext.data.Store store - The store that contains the available periods
